poem:
Title: Whispers of Lead in The City of Winds 

A choir of unseen danger sighs,  
In the husk of rattling pipes,  
129,000 innocent eyes reflect,  
Lead-etched tales of silence kept.  

Chicago dawned with somber news,  
In the river of progress, a chilling ruse.  
Beneath the swagger of the city's stride,  
A hushed villain, in plain sight, hides.
